definition: to open/to start (a business etc)/to set up

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: He mortgaged his house in order to start a business.
sentences.chinese: 他將房子作抵押借款以開辦一家商店。

sentences.english: These costs are charged to an asset account entitled organization costs.
sentences.chinese: 這些成本計入一個名爲開辦費的資產賬戶。

sentences.english: I. You are approved to launch the inter-bank entrusted loans business with financial institutions.
sentences.chinese: 同意你行開辦金融機構同業委託貸款業務。

sentences.english: Some local medical institutions also offer services for the rehabilitation and treatment of volunteer addicts.
sentences.chinese: 此外，一些地方在醫療單位開辦戒毒脫癮治療業務。

sentences.english: The computer centre opened last year is very popular among children.
sentences.chinese: 去年開辦的電腦中心很受孩子們的歡迎。

sentences.english: In 1995, there were two single-sex public schools operating in this country.
sentences.chinese: 1995年，兩所單性別公立學校在鄉下開辦。

sentences.english: Start-up costs are generally expensed when incurred.
sentences.chinese: 開辦費在發生當期即記入費用。

sentences.english: If you open a trading company in the Free Zone, you can enjoy the exemption of import-export duties.
sentences.chinese: 在免稅區開辦貿易公司，還可以享受進出口稅全免。

sentences.english: If you run a retail web site, this still applies.
sentences.chinese: 如果你開辦了一個零售業網站，同樣適用。

sentences.english: They're going to start an advanced course in English at that college.
sentences.chinese: 他們要在那個學院開辦一個英語高級班。

sentences.english: In Hong Kong, PolyU is the forerunner and sole provider of design education at tertiary level.
sentences.chinese: 理大是本港最先及唯一一所開辦設計教育的高等院校。

sentences.english: For example, opening a retail food store can be an all-consuming endeavor.
sentences.chinese: 例如，開辦一家零售食品店需要全力以赴。

sentences.english: Capital Verification Report at start-up or other relevant documentary evidence at its start-up.
sentences.chinese: 開辦時的驗資報告或者有關證明文件。

sentences.english: They will open a new supermarket there soon.
sentences.chinese: 他們很快將在那裏開辦個新超市。

sentences.english: Why not start a side business doing pet-sitting or training?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不開辦一個寵物照料或訓練的副業？

definition: to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
to start using/(computing) to enable (a feature)
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
